message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.DS 

The paper discusses a modelling framework for investigating prototype-based classifiers in non-stationary environments, specifically Learning Vector Quantization (LVQ) systems. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) as well as artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of analytical methods borrowed from statistical physics suggests a focus on neural networks (cs.NE) and complex systems (cs.SI). Finally, the study of learning curves and concept drift indicates a connection to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
